text: so part of my job at the French Culinary
Institute is coming up with new and
innovative foods that use technology and
we came up in this case with the edible
cocktail where we are making this
cucumber into a full-strength gin
martini so basically we're trying to cut
the cucumber into nice flat slices that
you could pick up off the plate and
we're going to use today Tanqueray a lot
of times nowadays people they just would
kind of wave the vermouth over the top
of the over the top of the gin I think
it's a mistake muscle just drink gin at
that point we're also going to add a
little simple syrup normally you would
stick the cucumbers in here then put a
great on top of it to hold it down but
since we want you be able to see what's
going on we're going to cheat a little
bit today and I'm going to stick a
paperclip into the actual cucumber just
to weight it down and the reason it
needs to be weighted down is that the
cucumber will not the cucumber has to be
under the liquid if the cucumber is not
under the liquid the vacuum won't be
able to inject the flavor into it this
is a vacuum machine it's normally used
to seal things in a vacuum for either
clicking or for preservation the
principle of rapid infusion or making
these edible cocktails is that when we
suck all of the air out of a product
like a cucumber as soon as the air comes
back in the air forces that forces the
gym into what used to be the air cells
and a fills it with gin and B gives it a
very beautiful translucent stained glass
look you're going to start seeing the
alcohol boiling
and at the same time you're going to see
the air getting sucked out of the
cucumber now turn the machine off the
air comes back in you're going to see
the cucumber change from being a pig to
be resolution
now you can see the paperclip through
the cucumber just take it out and well I
mean you can really see the paperclip
through it emits really turned
completely translucent and what's
interesting also is unlike a normal
pickle this is still super crunchy this
is as crunchy as it was we put in
probably a little more crunchy than it
was we put it in and yet it tastes it
tastes just like a martini we're going
to add some lime zest not too much a
little bit just to add that little
citrus note without being overpowering a
tiny tiny bit celery seed not salt too
much and it will turn bitter just a
little bit because a nice nice hint and
then finally and most importantly a
little bit of Maldon sea salt which has
a really nice texture as a nice crunch
you know I don't know of anyone that's
serving this at a restaurant right now
but many chefs are playing with the idea
of texture modification and flash
pickling using using the vacuum machine
and as more and more chefs have a vacuum
machine I think this is definitely gonna
be something you're going to see more of
in the future
